article.headline: Binghamton 57, Sam Houston St. 44
article.story: MILWAUKEE (AP) -- Andre Heard scored 14 points and Alex Adediran added 11 to lead Binghamton to a 57-44 win over Sam Houston State in the consolation game of the Blue and Gold Pepsi Classic in Milwaukee. Nick Billings added 10 points and 10 rebounds for Binghamton (1-2), which won its first game of the season. Eddy Fobbs led Sam Houston (1-3) with 13 points and 7 rebounds, while Wilder Auguste added 11 points. Marquette University, which is hosting the tournament, played Kent State in the tournaments championship game later Saturday evening. Sam Houston, which trailed for most of the game, cut the lead to 44-37 with 8:31 remaining on two free throws by Fobbs. Binghamton then went on an 8-2 run to grab a 52-39 lead on Billings rebound and short jump shot with 5:42 remaining. Binghamton then hit 5-of-6 free throws down the stretch, including two by Troy Hailey with 43 seconds remaining, to secure the victory. Sam Houston struggled offensively in the second half going nearly 10 minutes without a field goal. For the half, Sam Houston hit only 7-of-21 shots, or 33 percent. Binghamton was actually worse from the floor in the second half as they only hit 10 of 31 shots, or 32 percent. Binghamton went on a 12-4 run at the end of the first half to take a 31-22 halftime lead. Adediran, who had 11 points in the first half, scored eight points in a row during the run. Andre Heard added 7 points for Binghamton. Fobbs and Auguste scored 6 points each to lead Sam Houston State, which shot only 34.8 percent in the first half.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
